courseDescription:
During a financial challenge, your initial point of contact can either bring you relief or add to your stress. Are you in a situation or know someone around you who is in a crisis? Have you got a vision/idea? Help is here to help you kickstart it today. RSBA is a four step program to help people get back on their feet and complete what they always desired to do. Here is a step by step guide to get there with peace of mind and access to free resources whilst you build your vision. Learn to access a listing directory of charitable and community organisations providing free food and other supportive services. Explore how to obtain response services for food, toiletries, clothing, perishables and non-perishables. We will then discuss the topic of debt. Debt challenges are usually due to a lack of budgeting, mismanagement of money and overspending. Even people with savings in the bank can benefit from budgeting. Discover how to use a budget planner to manage your monthly expenses, be in a position to sustain financial commitments and prepare for life's unexpected events.

Are you looking to build on your current skills and experience? Developing a career path requires a substantial amount of time. We will teach you to select areas of interest and explore courses related to those fields. The career search process starts with writing a good CV with all the details of your qualification and work experience. Then, you will learn how to find the most suitable templates for writing CVs and cover letters, access online career portals and be prepared for your interview. Discover the Eloc Vision Starter 21 Day Acceleration program that can help kickstart a vision or business venture. Learn about the benefits of the Business Resource centre offering a diverse range of essential support. When you have reached a position of achievement that is personal to your circumstances then by sharing your success story it can have a positive influence on other people. They may be going through a similar situation and your story can inspire them to follow your path and change their lives for the better. We will demonstrate how to use an international story-sharing platform to ensure your good news helps inspire and motivate other people.

Overall this course is for anyone wanting to improve their quality of life and contribute to society. It is divided into four parts containing small and simple practical tasks to make it engaging. It also supplies links to the relevant RSBA1 online resources, forms and templates to guide you every step throughout the course. RSBA1 has engaged supermarkets, online stores, businesses and charities to work together to dimise poverty and educate people on financial sustainability and emergency management. Nearly every community is susceptible to some form of crisis which necessitates an increasing number of people to step forward and assist in crisis management to establish long-term sustainability for those affected. Learn about the web portal-based multipurpose RSBA1 platform to help yourself and others in times of difficulties. Join the course now!
